messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: another question, clarifying my post
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/30/2005 6:08:55 P.M. Eastern Standard Time, fivefreebirds@msn.com writes: *I have  an unschooling friend whose children just always go
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/30/2005 6:08:55 P.M. Eastern Standard Time,
fivefreebirds@... writes:

*I have an unschooling friend whose children just always go along.
In fact,
she can get away with doing some math worksheets and teachy things
because



************

I didn't say this right....."get away with" was not meant to imply that she
should be doing these things! So not unschooling! :)

I meant "get away with" as in her children just do them. My kids don't
"just do" much of anything, so I forget that some people (not radical
unschoolers) can choose what to "un" and what to homeschool.

Leslie in SC


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
